basics.name: Md Hasan Shahriar
basics.label: Graduate Student Researcher
basics.summary: Ph.D. student in Computer Science at Virginia Tech. Research interests lie at the intersection of cyber-physical systems (CPS), artificial intelligence (AI), and cybersecurity, with a focus on developing scalable, attack-resilient, and trustworthy AI frameworks for safety-critical systems, particularly in embodied AI systems such as connected and autonomous vehicles.

location.address: Complex Network and Security Research Lab

work.name: Complex Network and Security Research (CNSR) Lab, Virginia Tech
work.summary: Ph.D. research integrating cybersecurity, machine learning, and CPS to develop robust, resilient, and trustworthy AI for connected and autonomous vehicles. Designed intrusion detection systems for CAN and V2X networks, investigated multimodal fusion attacks, and developed unified defense frameworks.
highlights: Intrusion detection systems for CAN and V2X networks
Multimodal fusion attacks on autonomous perception
Unified defense against adversarial and backdoor attacks

work.name: Qualcomm Incorporated
work.summary: Executed real-world adversarial attacks on traffic sign detection systems. Investigated transferability of adversarial examples across diverse object detection models. Developed DVC-based pipelines for dataset management.

work.name: Qualcomm Incorporated
work.summary: Researched and evaluated generative AI models (GANs) to synthesize realistic yet fake V2X messages. Designed a GAN-based misbehavior detection system for anomalous basic safety messages (BSMs).

work.name: Analytics for Cyber Defense (ACyD) Lab, Florida International University
work.summary: M.S. research focused on securing cyber-physical systems, particularly detecting and mitigating stealthy threats in the smart grid. Developed threat synthesizer combining formal methods and GANs, and proposed deception-based moving target defense.
highlights: Threat synthesizer with formal methods and GANs
GAN-based defense models for network security

work.name: Electricity Generation Company Bangladesh Ltd.
work.summary: Operated a 2x120 MW gas turbine power plant by coordinating with the national load dispatch center. Developed operational and maintenance schedules to minimize downtime.
